subtitle: Cider and onions transform chicken thighs into a truly tasty dish. A quick and easy meal.

method.text: Put the flour into a bowl and season. Dip in the chicken thighs to coat with the flour.
Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Add the chicken and fry for 2 min each side until golden brown. Remove from pan and set aside.
Add the onion and garlic and fry for 5 min or until softened. Return chicken to the pan.
Pour in the cider, sprinkle in the thyme and season. Cover and simmer for 18-20 min, or until chicken is tender and cooked.
Put the Calvados in a small saucepan and warm gently. Light with a match. Allow the flames to die down before adding to the sauce. Serve.

title: Simple Somerset chicken
